title: Chapter 2618: Peerless Genius, My Pillar Treasure, Don’T Guess (2)
body:
Chapter 2618: Peerless Genius, My Pillar Treasure, Don’T Guess (2)

Chapter 2618: Peerless Genius, My Pillar Treasure, Don’t Guess (2)

Editor: Nyoi-Bo Studio

“He taught me.” Er Zhu scratched his head and pointed down.

Mei Siren looked around. In the end, he locked onto the pile of the remains of the Divine Puppet that had a trace of spiritual senses.

It was very familiar and it belonged to Xiaoshou.

However, was there a possibility that the Divine Puppet was part of Dao Qiongcang’s evil scheme?

“Which demon are you that dared to poison a person’s heart? Hurry up and show yourself! Mei Siren raised his Taicheng Sword and his murderous intent overflowed.

“Teacher, don’t you recognize me?” Jin Ren trembled.

At a certain moment, Jin Ren really thought that he was an independent entity. His spiritual senses were actually very different from the original body.

After Mei Siren recovered from his shock, he descended in joy and bent down beside the remains of the Divine Puppet.

“How can you confirm that you are truly Xu Xiaoshou?” He asked hesitantly.

“You Tu took a hit from my sword?”

At that moment, the old sword saint’s hand that held the Taicheng Sword trembled, and his expression changed drastically.

He glanced at Cao Erzhu in panic and quickly looked away. He took a deep breath to calm himself and shouted.

“That’s totally false. Don’t talk nonsense, kid!”

“Oh, are you sure?”

“Yes, I’m sure…” Mei Siren hurriedly changed the topic. “How did you end up like this?”

“Ah! Teacher, Ah!” All of a sudden, Jin Ren burst into tears. “Elder Dao the Flamboyant bullied me…”

“Don’t cry, don’t cry, Master is here.” Mei Siren’s heart ached. He picked up the pile of the remains of the Divine Puppet very carefully in case he broke some parts.

But even though he was so careful, some parts still fell out of the pile of scrap metal with a clang.

Mei Siren panicked.

He was not a Divine Sorcerer, so he didn’t know what part was important.

He also didn’t know if the copper-like thing that dropped out would affect Xu Xiaoshou’s current state.

“You, you, you…”

“It’s fine, Teacher. You can just pull out the head of the array wheel and keep it safe.”

“That’s all?”

“Yes.”

Mei Siren was very decisive. He slashed out with his Taicheng Sword and immediately cut off the precious head of the array wheel.

At this point, Jin Ren felt totally at ease.

This array wheel that contained all the data of the Divine Oracle was in an impenetrable fortress when it was in Master Siren’s hands.

At this moment, Cao Erzhu, who had blown up Dao Qiongcang’s head in his first battle, fell from the sky.

He withdrew his God Punishment Tribulation and looked hesitantly at the head of the array wheel in the old immortal’s hand. He asked in a strangely familiar tone.

“You are Xu Xiaoshou?”

Jin Ren was slightly surprised. His ‘Lord Shou’ name had already spread to a small place like Qingyuan Mountain, and even this guy knows me?

“I did not change my name. I’m Xu Xiaoshou!” He openly established his identity. With Master Siren around, he was not afraid of anything.

Cao Erzhu rubbed his hands and scratched his head in embarrassment. “My name is Cao Erzhu. Thank you very much. You helped me vent my anger just now…”

Hmm?

Why did these words sound a little strange?

“It’s nothing. No need to mention.” Jin Ren quickly brushed this matter aside. “Do you know me?”

“Yes, Sister August left a note. You should know her.” Cao Erzhu carefully took out a piece of paper from his ring.

When he flipped the paper over, on it were the words, ‘Xu Xiaoshou’ written in an elegant script.

“August…”

Jin Ren frowned and thought about it carefully, but he didn’t know this person.

He had never even heard of this name before, let alone seen it.

However, his name was indeed written on that piece of paper. Perhaps the other party knew him. After all, who in the world did not know the name ‘Lord Shou’?

“I don’t know this ‘August’ you’re talking about.”

“If you have more information, such as why she left this name, or what message she asked you to send me…”

After a pause, he saw that there was no reaction from Cao Erzhu; he only looked very politely at the head of the array wheel. Jin Ren carefully considered his words and said, “Maybe I can help you with something?”

“There isn’t.” After Cao Erzhu listened intently, he waved his hand. “She only left this name. I don’t know if she wanted me to wait…”

Wait a minute!

This was the first time they met, and Xu Xiaoshou didn’t even know who Sister August was. Wasn’t it inappropriate for him to say that he was waiting for him?

Cao Erzhu was not brainless. He felt that if he spoke like this, he would seem like a weirdo.

Suddenly, he felt a sense of loss as if all the clues had gone missing.

“No more.”

Cao Erzhu waved his hand again and took a step back. He was slightly disappointed. “Since you don’t know Sister August, then perhaps I’m thinking too much.”

You’re a strange fellow.

Jin Ren wanted to say something.

When he saw the big guy’s wary expression and how he took a step back to maintain a safe distance, he stopped talking.

At this moment, the discomfort of silence would most likely make those who were even more at a loss choose to speak.

If he could reveal more, the information would be more complete, and Jin Ren would have a better grasp of the situation.

Cao Erzhu opened his mouth. Indeed, he could not adapt to the awkwardness of this silence. He wanted to say something, but he could not.

“August, was she the student who followed the bad-tempered old man you mentioned?” Mei Siren interrupted.

I didn’t say that he had a bad temper. The old man had a very good temperament…Cao Erzhu turned around and looked slightly stunned. He quickly nodded. “Yes, the old immortal.”
